About
About
I am Abalo Theopista, a final year forestry student at Makerere University. I served as the regional representative of Southern Africa with the International Forestry Students Association, and currently an FAO Young Forest Champion 2025.

I am passionate about research in areas of sustainable forest resource management and utilization. I am always eager to contribute to a more sustainable world for a better mother nature and the life it houses. 

I'm a skilled communicator and collaborative team leader, with a strong ability to learn and adapt quickly. I'm passionate about continuous growth and seeking opportunities to challenge myself, particularly in initiatives and organizations that prioritize sustainable natural resource management and environmental protection. I believe in working towards a future where our natural resources are preserved and utilized responsibly, without compromising the environment's integrity.

I’m happy to share that I’m starting a new position as GLF/YiL Focal Point person at International Forestry Students'​ Association (IFSA).

In this role, I’ll be working closely with the External Councilor and Head of Partner Commission Theopista Abalo to strengthen IFSA’s collaboration with the Global Landscapes Forum (GLF) and Youth in Landscape Initiative (YIL). 

I will empower young forestry voices, fostering partnerships, and amplifying youth-led actions for sustainable landscapes.

I look forward to contributing to a more connected and impactful global forestry community who are acting locally but impacting globally🌳
